isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - BRAKE SWITCH CIRCUITS (BRAKE) - EXTENDED DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: EXTENDED DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The service brake circuit function is to signal the ECM when the brake pedal is applied. This information is used to disengage the Cruise control and PTO functions. This signal is also used for ECM control of the Vehicle Retarder and compression brake enabling. The brake signal will interrupt the Cold Ambient Protection feature and will reset the time interval for the Idle Shut Down feature.
Four systems are used for the service brake signal.
